description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

description: On June 17, 2020, in Belarus, the Ministry of Health published recommendations for the prevention of COVID-19 in health resort organizations/sanatoriums. Recommendations include breaks between arrivals of vacationers for general cleaning and disinfection. If the institution has its own transport, which provides services to vacationers (transfer, excursions), it should be sanitized after use. It is necessary to organize daily wet cleaning of premises using household detergents or disinfectants with the treatment of all surfaces. Surfaces include door handles, handrails, elevator buttons, tables, chairs, other pieces of furniture, sanitary equipment, telephones, office equipment panels and other items that people touch. Daily disinfection is also necessary in regards to the surfaces of equipment and elements of small architectural forms on the street (examples include the gym, sports grounds, gazebos, benches, beach equipment). It is recommended to ventilate the premises regularly. Dispensers with an antiseptic (disinfectant) hand sanitizer (preferably alcohol-based) should be regularly maintained. After appointments for medical services or procedures, it is necessary to disinfect the surfaces and ventilate the room.

These rules state that persons who are in self-isolation: must not leave their place of residence (or stay), including visiting places of work (study), shops, shopping centers, catering facilities, sports, exhibition and concert halls, cinemas, train stations and other places of mass stay of people, except in cases of extreme necessity; must use the services of online stores to purchase goods, excluding direct contact with the persons who delivered the goods; must perform a number of hygiene measures (wash hands thoroughly with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, or use an antiseptic to treat hands; use disposable handkerchiefs or napkins with subsequent disposal in a closed trash can or plastic bag, etc.); in case of a deterioration in health (an increase in body temperature of 370C and above, the appearance of coughing, shortness of breath), they should contact an ambulance by calling 103 or by SMS. description: In Belarus, on February 27, 2020 the Ministry of Health enforces quarantine COVID-19 patients and their first-level contacts in medical facilities. The application of this practice began with the identification of the first infected person. UPDATE: On April 9, 2020 it was announced that citizens of Belarus, foreigners and stateless persons should be placed on self-isolation in Belarus if they have a COVID-19 infection; if they relate to contacts: of the first level with persons with COVID-19 infection - within 14 calendar days from the date of the last contact; second level with persons with COVID-19 infection, in the presence of one or more respiratory symptoms - for the period of the indicated symptoms. The Ministry of Health can establish which level of contacts this or that person belongs to if they arrived in Belarus from countries in which cases of COVID-19 infection are registered, within 14 calendar days from the date of arrival. Those who go to self-isolation will be given a requirement to comply with the rules. For this period, people will be issued a certificate of incapacity for work if they, as well as themselves, pay compulsory insurance premiums. If a person violates the requirements for self-isolation, then temporary disability benefits will be assigned in the amount of 50 percent of what is required by law. The periods of stay of citizens in self-isolation can be extended by the decision of doctors. Violators face fines and liability, including to a criminal level. Those in self-isolation are required to not leave their place of residence and are only allowed to go to the nearest grocery store or pharmacy, as well as take out the trash. When leaving the living quarters in cases of extreme necessity, they must use a mask. description: On June 17 in Belarus, 2020, the Ministry of Health published recommendations for the prevention of COVID-19 in health resort organizations/sanatoriums. Recommendations include one-time arrival of vacationers and the use of signal markings ad the check-in counter which informs vacationers that they must be distanced at the counter during their check-in and check-out. In canteens, tables must be arranged to be placed at least at a 1.5-2 m distance from each other. It is recommended to reduce the number of people simultaneously in the dining room. When organizing food through the distribution line, the operation of a buffet or a store on the floor, signal markings should be applied about the need to maintain a distance. If the organization has its own beach, it is recommended to place beach equipment with a distance of at least 1.5-2 m from each other. In regards to the gym, it is necessary to ensure the distance between the guests, including by arranging the equipment, is at least 1.5-2 m. If the institution has its own transport, which provides services to vacationers (transfer, excursions), it should be filled with respect to distance.
